means: 中心装饰品（餐桌中央的摆饰）

sentence.Network_en: Education was the centerpiece of the democratic party's political platform.

sentence.Network_en: Health care for children is the centerpiece of our program.
sentence.Network_cn: 儿童的健康保健是我们计划的主轴.

means.word_mean: 1. the central or most important feature;

sentences.sentence: "education was the centerpiece of the Democratic Party's political platform"

means.word_mean: 2. something placed at the center of something else (as on a table)
